title: Valentine-themed website dedicated to Ahana

requirements.text: Create a responsive, single-page Valentine website dedicated to the name “Ahana”, with all user-facing text in English and a romantic tone.

quotes: Make a website for my gf name “ahana” for velentine

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage renders without errors on desktop and mobile widths.
The name “Ahana” is prominently displayed in the hero section.
All visible text is in English.
Content and visuals clearly communicate a Valentine/romantic theme.

requirements.text: Implement a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a Valentine/love-letter aesthetic, applied consistently across the page (avoid a blue/purple primary palette).

quotes: Make a website for my gf name “ahana” for velentine

acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is used across all sections (typography + color palette + spacing).
Primary styling is not based on blue/purple as the dominant palette.
UI remains readable with sufficient contrast for text on backgrounds.

requirements.text: Add core sections to the page: (1) Hero banner, (2) Short love note/letter, (3) “Reasons I love you” list (static), and (4) A closing call-to-action section such as “Will you be my Valentine?” with simple on-page interaction (no authentication).

quotes: Make a website for my gf name “ahana” for velentine

acceptanceCriteria: All four sections are present and reachable by scrolling.
The “Reasons I love you” list displays at least 5 items.
The closing section includes a simple interaction (e.g., buttons or toggle) that updates the UI state locally in the browser.

requirements.text: Add lightweight decorative animations suitable for the theme (e.g., floating hearts or subtle sparkles) that respect performance and accessibility (provide a way to reduce motion if the user prefers reduced motion).

quotes: Make a website for my gf name “ahana” for velentine

acceptanceCriteria: At least one decorative animation is visible on the page.
If the OS/browser prefers-reduced-motion setting is enabled, animations are reduced/disabled appropriately.
Animation does not significantly degrade scrolling or interaction responsiveness.

requirements.text: Add required static image assets to the project and render them on the page from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).

quotes: Make a website for my gf name “ahana” for velentine

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The homepage renders and displays the generated assets (e.g., hero background/illustration and a small decorative icon).
No backend endpoints are used for image delivery.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
nonGoals: Internet Identity login or any third-party authentication.
User accounts, admin panels, or content management.
Payments, donations, or external API integrations.
Collecting or storing personal data on the backend.

required: Romantic heart-pattern background with soft gradients (ahana-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Cute Valentine-themed envelope-and-heart illustration, flat/vector style (ahana-hero-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
Small heart icon, simple flat style (heart-icon.dim_128x128.png)
